Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20110608 SeaMonkey/2.1

I entered my master password for Password Manager to supply the login user ID and password for a Web site.  On the SeaMonkey menu bar, I then selected [Tools > Password Manager > Manage Stored Passwords].  I was still logged-in for my master password since Data Manager gave me the Passwords tab and allowed me to select domains.  I selected a domain and then selected the Show Passwords button.  When the dialogue popup for my master password then appeared, I selected the Cancel button.  Subsequent navigation that would require that my master password be entered did indeed launch the dialogue popup for my master password.  

The effect of the Cancel button on the dialogue popup was as if I had selected [Tools > Password Manager > Log Out] on the SeaMonkey menu bar.  The first entry of my master password should remain in effect even if I cancel the second request.

comments.text:
As with the old password manager, the only way we can prompt for the master password is to log out and log back in. So I don't think this can be fixed.

This behaviour was never documented, so it's not surprising that you didn't know about it. You could request that it be documented as part of the help update for data manager.

comments.text:
Do I have this correct?

1.  I login to my master password in order to have Password Manager supply the login password to some Web site.  

2.  I go to Data Manager and select Passwords Only.  

3.  In the Domain pane, I select a domain.  

4.  In the Passwords pane, I select a URI and then select the Show Passwords button.  

The result is that my login in step #1 is logged out and then a prompt for my master password appears.  

Is this per design??  If so, the design is faulty.
